title: Hatay Province
summary: Hatay Province (Turkish: Hatay ili, pronounced [ˈhataj], پارێزگای خاتای, Arabic: لواء إسكندرون‎, romanized: Liwa Iskenderun, lit. 'District of Alexandretta' ) is the southernmost province of Turkey.[2] It is situated almost entirely outside Anatolia, along the eastern coast of the Levantine Sea. The province borders Syria to its south and east, and the Turkish provinces of Adana and Osmaniye to its north. It is part of Çukurova, a large fertile plain along the cultural region of Cilicia, and its administrative capital is Antakya.
